intro: Lepidaploa uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower lepidaploa, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates with ample sunlight. Its small, showy flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces capsule fruits containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
